result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Devonte Fisher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert Devonte Fisher is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert Devonte Fisher was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation to be concurrent to the sentence imposed as to case 15CF000066.

miscConds.notes:
Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation. 
If confinement is served-DOC to collect monetary  sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.   Balance as a condition of Extended Supevision.
Failure to pay wil result in a civil judgment.
---Restitution set at zero.
Seek/maintain full time employment,  or part time employment and school, or full time school.

Court orders defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis if not already done so.
Court advised the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

No drugs without a valid prescription.
No Contact Order with the TMobile retail store and/or U. S. Cellular retail store, and/or the address of 1528 S. 108 Street, City of West Allis, and/or  6770 W. National Avenue, City of West Allis.
No contact with any gang members.
AODA assessment. Comply with any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert Devonte Fisher not in court.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.

COPY OF NOTICE OF INTENT, court record sheet and judgment of conviction forwarded to the State Public Defender's Office in Madison.pk
records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Amended, showing bail was applied.

Defendant Robert Devonte Fisher in court with Attorney Mark S Rosen.  Defendant Robert Devonte Fisher in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has three cases before the court.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, Roosevelt F., Vercarre W., Joseph P., defense counsel and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  30  months  with  Zero  days credit, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  18  months; EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  12 months.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  4  years.
  Probation to be CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Case# 15CF000066.

Court finds defendant  IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program  and  IS  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

-  Court sets Restitution at $0  (zero)

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  Complete a Fatherhood program
-  Seek/Maintain full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  No Contact Order with the TMobile retail store    AND/OR   the  U.S. Cellular retail store   AND/OR  the address of 1528 South 108th Street, City of West Allis     AND/OR   the address of 6770 West National Avenue, City of West Allis
-  No Contact with any gang members
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 

-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  Complete a Fatherhood program
-  Seek/Maintain full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  No Contact Order with the TMobile retail store   AND/OR   the U.S. Cellular retail store    AND/OR  the address of 1528 South 108th Street, City of West Allis     AND/OR   the address of 6770 West National Avenue, City of West Allis
-  No Contact with any gang members
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
If Confinement is served -  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
NOTICE OF INTENT TO PURSUE POST-CONVICTION RELIEF RECEIVED AND FILED ON 2-12-16.pk

records.addlTxt:
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Devonte Fisher in court with Attorney Mark S Rosen.  Defendant Robert Devonte Fisher in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled.

As to Count 1:
Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

As to Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Count 2 dismissed.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored. 

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.  No PSI ordered.  Jury trial is vacated.

Defendant Robert Devonte Fisher in court with attorney Mark S Rosen.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Defense Counsel requests sequestration of State's witnesses.  Sworn for the state:Joseph Saric-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is reassigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21 due to lower pending case.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling Conference is set for February 27, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Robert Devonte Fisher in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Robert Devonte Fisher in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  AS TO COUNT 1:  Motion to dismiss by defense FOR LACK OF PROBABLE CAUSE argued and DENIED by the Court.  On State's motion, Court amended probable cause section to reflect correct time of alleged offense.  AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
